unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reported a surge in gastroenteritis cases post-Diwali, with Dr. Sharma attributing it to food contamination. Over 500 patients visited the emergency ward between 25/10/2024 and 31/10/2024, a 40% increase compared to the previous week. Common symptoms included severe abdominal pain, vomiting, and dehydration.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reported a surge in gastroenteritis cases post-Diwali, with Doctor Sharma attributing it to food contamination. Over five hundred patients visited the emergency ward between twenty fifth october two thousand and twenty four and thirty first october two thousand and twenty four, a forty percent increase compared to the previous week. Common symptoms included severe abdominal pain, vomiting, and dehydration.

unnormalised: “Many patients admitted consuming sweets and snacks from unhygienic sources,” said Dr. Sharma in a press briefing held at 11:00 AM on 01/11/2024. The hospital saw a significant number of cases involving children under the age of 10 yrs. Health officials advised citizens to exercise caution when consuming food from street vendors and to prioritize home-cooked meals during festive seasons.

The hospital saw a significant number of cases involving children under the age of ten years. Health officials advised citizens to exercise caution when consuming food from street vendors and to prioritize home-cooked meals during festive seasons.

unnormalised: The surge is particularly concerning because of the potential for rapid spread, especially in densely populated areas like Old Delhi. The hospital's gastroenterology department has been working overtime, with Dr. Patel leading the charge. The OPD, normally seeing around 150 patients a day, has been handling close to 250.
normalised: The surge is particularly concerning because of the potential for rapid spread, especially in densely populated areas like Old Delhi. The hospital's gastroenterology department has been working overtime, with Doctor Patel leading the charge. The O-P-D, normally seeing around one hundred and fifty patients a day, has been handling close to two hundred and fifty.

unnormalised: Medical staff are administering IV fluids and prescribing oral rehydration solutions to combat dehydration. Some patients are also being treated with antibiotics to manage bacterial infections, with dosages ranging from 250mg to 500mg depending on the severity. The hospital is also distributing pamphlets in Hindi and English, educating people about food safety and hygiene.
normalised: Medical staff are administering I-V fluids and prescribing oral rehydration solutions to combat dehydration. Some patients are also being treated with antibiotics to manage bacterial infections, with dosages ranging from two hundred and fifty milligram to five hundred milligram depending on the severity. The hospital is also distributing pamphlets in Hindi and English, educating people about food safety and hygiene.

unnormalised: The situation highlights the urgent need for better food safety regulations and enforcement, especially around festive times when demand surges and oversight can be lax. The local municipal corporation (MCD) has initiated inspections of food stalls in various markets, issuing warnings to vendors found violating hygiene standards. They've also promised to confiscate any food items deemed unsafe for consumption.

unnormalised: Adding to the complexity, several cases of typhoid have also been reported alongside gastroenteritis. Diagnoses are being confirmed through Widal tests, with results often taking 24-48 hrs. The hospital is urging people to get tested promptly if they experience prolonged fever or gastrointestinal issues.

unnormalised: The AIIMS administration has made arrangements for additional beds and staff to manage the influx of patients. They are also collaborating with local NGOs to provide clean drinking water and sanitation facilities in affected areas. The hospital remains on high alert, monitoring the situation closely and providing necessary medical care to those affected. The next press briefing is scheduled for 07/11/2024 at 2 PM.
